meanings.definition: To slide down a snowy hill on a toboggan.
meanings.sent1: The children tobogganed down the hill with joy.
meanings.sent2: We tobogganed together on the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The penguins tobogganed on the ice, looking like little sledding experts.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter tobogganed through the room, infectious and bright.
meanings.sent5: The memory of tobogganing down that hill will stay with me forever.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we tobogganed down the hill.
meanings.sent2: They tobogganed all afternoon and had a great time.
meanings.sent3: The cat tobogganed across the floor, pretending to sled.
meanings.sent4: His voice tobogganed in pitch as he recounted the story.
meanings.sent5: The sun had set by the time they tobogganed back home.
